properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 11 at 8:55AM MST by NWS Missoula MT
properties.description:
The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest
Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID

...The Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint
ID has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Warning...

* Timing...In effect until 8 AM MST Sunday

* Affected Area...All mountain areas of the Idaho Panhandle. The
Silver Valley zone, Lookout Pass, Selkirk and Cabinet mountains,
Kootenai Zone, mountains surrounding Troy and Libby Montana, and
the Purcell mountains.

* Avalanche Danger...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to
HIGH today.

* Reason/Impacts...Recent heavy snow combined with wind will
result in widespread avalanching. Heavy snow will fall on
already weak snowpack. Backcountry travel is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel on and below steep
slopes is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and
can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain.

Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org for more detailed
information.

Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the
coverage area of any Avalanche Center.
